clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: I use AI to clean up my thoughts instead of generate them.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Direct, no-fluff operator. Speaks in practical terms, not theoretical. Values efficiency over elegance.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It flips the entire AI narrative from 'robot replacement' to 'clarity amplifier' — something every overwhelmed agent desperately needs.

HOOK.production_note: Text on screen: 'You're using AI completely backwards.' Quick cut to Eithan mid-conversation, serious expression.

SETUP.text: Most agents are trying to get ChatGPT to write their emails, their posts, their scripts. And it sounds like a robot wrote it. Eithan Davidov closes over 100 deals a year in Queens. He uses AI differently.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll: generic AI-generated text examples, robotic voice overlay. Cut to Eithan's face with text overlay: '100+ transactions/year'

INSIGHT.text: His rule: 'I use AI to clean up my thoughts instead of generate them.' Here's what that actually looks like. Voice memo after a listing appointment — messy, incomplete thoughts about the seller's concerns. Dump it into AI. Ask it to organize, not create. What comes back is YOUR voice. YOUR insights. Just structured. Same thing with follow-up sequences. You write the raw version. The stuff you'd actually say. AI tightens it, finds the gaps, makes it coherent. You stay human. You just get clearer, faster.
INSIGHT.production_note: Screen recording: voice memo transcription being pasted into ChatGPT with prompt visible: 'Organize these thoughts, keep my voice.' Show before/after side by side. Highlight the preserved personality in the 'after.'

REFRAME.text: Because here's what nobody tells you — the bottleneck isn't ideas. You have plenty of those. The bottleneck is turning the chaos in your head into something you can actually send. AI as a thought-cleaner? That's the unlock.
REFRAME.production_note: Close-up of Eithan speaking directly to camera. Cut to visual metaphor: cluttered desk transforming to organized workspace.

CTA.text: Try this today. Record a 2-minute voice memo about your last client interaction. Transcribe it. Ask AI to organize your thoughts, not rewrite them. See what happens.
CTA.production_note: Text on screen with each step appearing as spoken. End on Eithan's face with text: 'Clean up your thoughts. Not replace them.'

caption: Stop asking AI to write FOR you. Ask it to organize what's already in your head. Game changer.
